sentences.sContent: Sales this month have reached a new peak .
sentences.sCn: 本月的销售额创了新高。

sentences.sContent: Most athletes reach their peak in their mid 20s.
sentences.sCn: 大多数运动员在25岁左右达到巅峰状态。

sentences.sContent: He’s past his peak as a tennis player.
sentences.sCn: 作为网球运动员他已过了巅峰期。

sentences.sContent: Oil production is down from its peak of two years ago.
sentences.sCn: 石油生产已比不上两年前的鼎盛时期。

sentences.sContent: the peaks and troughs of the US economy (= high and low points )
Temperatures have peaked at over 90 degrees.
sentences.sCn: 温度已达到峰值，超过了90度。

synos.tran: 山峰；最高点；顶点；[服装]帽舌
消瘦；到达最高点；变憔悴

phrases.pCn: （收听广播、收看电视的）高峰时间
峰值负载抑制；高峰调节
峰值压力；巅峰压力；最大压力
峰值电压；峰压；最大电压
峰值加速度；最大加速度值
反峰电压；反向峰值电压

remMethod.val: peak作为“山峰”一意大家都熟悉

words.tran: 到达高点，消瘦，竖起（peak的过去式和过去分词形式）

trans.tranOther: the time when something or someone is best, greatest, highest, most successful etc
When something peaks, it reaches its highest value or its highest level
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something
